oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Yellow Dog blues (1919 version)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sheet music for the song Yellow Dog Blues (1919 version), by W.C. Handy. The cover is of a man playing banjo at night, with trees and a full moon in the background.

Blues is a musical form and genre that originated in African American communities in the rural U.S. South, particularly the Mississippi Delta, around the end of the 19th century. It developed from a fusion of traditional African music and European folk music, and incorporates spirituals, work songs, field hollers, shouts and chants, and rhymed ballads.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: W.C. Handy
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Kenneth D. Rose Sheet Music Collection
